title.narrative: 06-03 BIRTH REGISTRATION

description.narrative: 6.3. By 2021, the government, partners and communities have increased capacity to provide birth registration services for children under five at national and subnational levels., which contributes to Birth Registration, Prevention Of Harmful Practice, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 6. By 2021, children benefit from a system that ensures integrated, improved and equitable prevention of and response to violence, abuse, exploitation and neglect.

sector.narrative: Justice, birth registration/CRVS, and alternative care - planning, co-ordination and programme monitoring
Legal identity (including birth registration/civil registration and vital statistics systems)
Research, evaluation and other evidence generation and use - Care

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 6.3. By 2021, the government, partners and communities have increased capacity to provide birth registration services for childrenunder five at national and subnational levels.

description.narrative: UNICEF;continued strengthening Government and partners’ capacities;in birth registration services. UNICEF supported the finalisation and adoption of the 2nd CRVS NSAP (2021–25), development;of;the;National CRVS Policy, finalisation of the;birth;registration;guidelines;for;health;workers and capacity;building;of health;workers and community health volunteers. Birth registration module is the foundation of;the national;integrated registration information system.;Community;awareness activities reached an estimated 3.2 million people. The support resulted in the registration of 49,436 children.;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/01/2022

National budget allocated for birth registration increased(48592), Text

target.value: 2022:Civil/Birth registration budgetary allocation done as a sub-programme and in line with the national CRVS strategic plan

actual.value: 2021:Public expenditure review draft report as well as civil registration being included as a sub-programme in the national budget.

title.narrative: Existence of a national civil registration and vital statistics strategy(ies) which reflects recent international standards and principles for CRVS systems and are in line with the human rights conventions and protocols ratified by the State, Text

actual.value: 2021:SIs (44, 34 & 83) in place for decentralization of birth certificates & INRIS legal framework; 806 BR desks in HFs
